Cognitive Impact: External memory storage, preservation of knowledge, shift from oral to symbolic thought.
Societal Impact: Enabled administration, history keeping, and formation of complex societies.

Cognitive Impact: Enabled mass literacy, externalized memory, and broader critical thought.
Societal Impact: Democratized knowledge, catalyzed Reformation and Enlightenment.

Cognitive Impact: Annihilation of distance, real-time communication altered perception of time and space.
Societal Impact: Enabled coordinated business, diplomacy, and news dissemination.

Cognitive Impact: Created shared listening/viewing experiences; audio-visual learning.
Societal Impact: Mass culture formation, wartime propaganda, real-time national experiences.

Cognitive Impact: Visual narrative dominance, attention span concerns, televised learning.
Societal Impact: Family co-viewing, consumer culture, televised politics and protests.

Cognitive Impact: Always-on connectivity, multitasking, algorithmic influence on attention and beliefs.
Societal Impact: Global communication, disruption of legacy media, polarization, misinformation.
Key Figures: Tim Berners-Lee, Mark Zuckerberg, Jack Dorsey
